findings.rationale: The employer gains a perpetual and exclusive license to all work products, which may limit the employee's future opportunities and ownership over their creations.
findings.evidence_quote: Provider grants Employer a perpetual, exclusive license to use all work product created during employment for Employer's business purposes.

findings.rationale: A one-year non-compete clause may restrict the employee's ability to find new employment in their field, potentially leading to financial instability.
findings.evidence_quote: Employee may not compete within the same industry for 1 year after termination, within Employer's service area.

findings.rationale: The ability for either party to terminate the agreement with only 30 days notice may create uncertainty and instability for the employee's position.
findings.evidence_quote: Either party may terminate for convenience with 30 days written notice.

findings.rationale: Capping indemnification at annual compensation may expose the employee to significant financial risk in case of negligence.
findings.evidence_quote: Mutual indemnification: each party indemnifies the other for its own negligence, capped at annual compensation.

findings.rationale: A three-year confidentiality obligation post-termination may be excessive and could hinder the employee's ability to work freely.
findings.evidence_quote: Confidentiality obligations survive termination and continue for 3 years.
